line_1: Upon all but the owl and the bat:
line_2: Each one by the side of its mate;

line_1: And where the drowsy half-blind bat
line_2: Where the hoar rock majestic sat,

line_1: Of Solitude fond as a Bat:
line_2: Himself with joy. — There down he sat,

line_1: We curse the Dog, and loath the shapeless Bat
The lizard, and the lazy lurking bat,
line_2: Where the sage matron and her maidens sat,
